intro: Ambrosia elata, commonly known as the giant ragweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in spherical clusters, which are wind-pollinated. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Ambrosia elata is known for its allergenic properties, contributing to ragweed pollen allergies.
